work.p: These two drafts are early versions of the poem "To the Pending Year," which was published first as "To the Year 1889" in the January 5, 1889, issue of the Critic.

titleStmt.title: Down, down, proud gorge and Are they last words? a machine readable transcription
titleStmt.author: Walt Whitman

notesStmt.note: This manuscript was probably composed in late 1888 in anticipation of publication in early 1889.

bibl.author: Walt Whitman
bibl.title: Down, down proud gorge

bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

lg.head: Down, down, proud gorge
lg.l: Down, down, proud gorge, tho' choking thee!
Thy haughty high-borne rebellious forehead to the gutter,
Thy Crouch, crouch thy neck to eleemosynary ? gifts

lg.head:
Is't indeed Are they
thy my
last words?
lg.l: No, I have many are left,
Scarifying devouring flam ses. O year

Have not fought out my battle yet— fought my best steadily,
warily
Thy silliness, scorn, thy affectations lisps, thy income,
Have I said all yet? O year world?
